intro: Hieracium guthnikianum, commonly known as the Guthnikian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc and surrounding ray florets. Hieracium guthnikianum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
